summary: A letter from defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim to Judge Alison J. Nathan requesting an order to allow Ghislaine Maxwell access to her legal papers while held in a cellblock at the courthouse during an evidence review. The letter details Maxwell's schedule on the day it was written.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell writing to the judge to request an order allowing her client access to legal papers while in custody.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the request letter is addressed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, who is in custody and attending an evidence review. Her attorney is requesting she be allowed access to her legal papers while held in the cellblock.

connections.description: Sternheim is acting as Maxwell's defense attorney, making legal requests on her behalf.
Judge Nathan is the presiding judicial officer over Maxwell's criminal case.

events.title: Request for Access to Legal Papers
events.description: Defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim writes to Judge Nathan requesting an order to allow Ghislaine Maxwell access to her legal papers while held in a cellblock during an evidence review.

events.title: Maxwell's Courthouse Schedule
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell arrived at the courthouse at approximately 5:15 am, was held idle in a cellblock until about 8:30 am, and was then brought to an evidence review session.

locations: 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY (courthouse cellblock location)
40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007 (United States Courthouse)
33 West 19th Street, New York, NY 10011 (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in federal custody and attending an evidence review related to her criminal case in April 2021.
Her defense attorney requested a court order to grant her access to her legal papers while she was held in a cellblock at 500 Pearl Street.
On April 13, 2021, Maxwell arrived at the courthouse very early (5:15 am) and had a period of idle waiting before her evidence review session began.
The document is a formal request from defense counsel to the presiding judge, indicating ongoing pre-trial proceedings in the case.
